intro: Bobartia filiformis, commonly known as the slender bobartia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
